Key Match Events: Josh Smith put Texas ahead for the first time with a two-run single in the seventh inning and the Rangers overcame a pair of two-run deficits to beat the Angels 6-4 on Saturday night.
Taylor Ward led off the game with his 22nd homer, which just cleared the eight-foot wall in left to extend his on-base streak to 17 games.
Neto scored from second base on a wild pitch in the sixth after Leiter walked him to start the inning and was pulled from the game.
Marcus Semien’s RBI single that came after a five-for-39 stretch for the Texas leadoff hitter.
Victor Mederos (0-1) had just walked the Nos. 8 and 9 batters with two outs — with ball four on the first free pass coming on a pitch-clock violation.
Post-Match Reflections: At this point in the season, just to show that fight kind of shows what everybody’s made up a little bit,” Smith said.
“We know where we’re at, and so it’s up to us to keep going out there and playing hard, trying to win ballgames,” manager Bruce Bochy said after the Rangers’ 32nd comeback win this season.
“It all started when we didn’t catch that one groundball, and then [Anderson] sort of lost it a little bit,” Angels manager Ron Washington said.
Miscellaneous Highlights: With the Globe Life Park roof open for the first time since May 17, Taylor Ward led of the game with his 22nd homer.
The Rangers won for the ninth time in 12 games — their best such stretch this season.
The Rangers are still 8 1/2 games behind American League West-leading Houston and 7½ games out of a wild-card spot with 19 to play.
Angels starter Tyler Anderson struck out seven and yielded only one hit while throwing 92 pitches in five innings.
Injury updates: Angels: Outfielders Jo Adell (left oblique strain) and Kevin Pillar (left thumb sprain) were placed on the 10-day injured list.
Others: Angels starting pitcher Tyler Anderson gave up one hit and one earned run over five innings during a 6-4 loss to the Texas Rangers on Saturday at Globe Life Field.
The 24-year-old right-hander, the second pick in the 2021 amateur draft, made his third consecutive start in the Rangers’ rotation.
All-Star closer Kirby Yates worked the ninth for his 28th save in 29 chances.
Rookie Samuel Aldegheri earns his first MLB win as Angels beat Rangers
